channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox, 20th December
item.description:
Fox is lying 10 meters from junction of Greenway and White horse hill on right hand pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Greenway, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree uprooted, 20th December
item.description:
Tree uprooted - probably vandalism - may be able to save the tree if replanted and protected. Also for months now, significant amount of tree cuttings dumped on the green space. When grass was cut by the Council, they just skirted round the cuttings rather than removing them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paxton Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 20th December
item.description:
Street light out on corner of Emerson Street and Sumner Street, outside the Forge building. Makes crossing the road at this corner hazardous. No identifying label on the post.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Emerson Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boxes again opposite bus stop., 20th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Dog owners using playground as dog toilet, 20th December
item.description:
The amount of dog poo in the playground between Eynsford House, Hever House, and Lamberhurst House is out of hand. This used to be a minor issue but lately it seems lots of dog owners now think it’s acceptable to use the playground that my 3 year old son likes to play in as their convenient dog toilet. There is a sign inside the playground indicating dogs aren’t allowed but no one pays attention to that.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovelinch Close, New Cross Gate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could this section of path be swept clear of rotting leaves please?, 19th December
item.description:
This section of the path needs to be swept if possible so it doesnt become a trip/slip hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping and household rubbish outside our entrance gate, 19th December
item.description:
About two weeks ago someone dumped a load of household rubbish and furniture outside the entrance gate to our properties along Clapton Passage . Since that time other rubbish and food waste has been thrown there and it’s becoming a problem .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Passage, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish AT THE TOP of 56 Crampton St close, 19th December
item.description:
There is rubbish, a mattress, debris, a lot of mess AT THE TOP OF THE CLOSE at 56 Crampton St. This was reported on last week, marked as closed, but it has not been resolved. Cleaners have cleaned the stairs but then refusing it seems to sort the rest. Please can you sort?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Crampton Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Hermiston Avenue, Hornsey, Greater London

item.title: Car abandoned on double yellow lines for the pst week., 19th December
item.description:
For the past week there has been a white Volvo, with registration YE75 VGS, parked on the double yellow lines at the entrance of Weir Road DA5 for the past week. There is a blue badge on the dashboard, yet the car has seemingly been there 24/7 all week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
